00027 /*
00028  * Lattice Semiconductor Corp. namespace for LatticeSC device.
00029  */
00030 namespace LatticeSemi_PCIe

00032 
00033 
00058 class DLLIMPORT Device
00059 {
00060 public:
00061     Device(LatticeSemi_PCIe::RegisterAccess *pReg,
00062            const char *nameStr,
00063            uint32_t addr,
00064            uint32_t range);
00065     virtual ~Device();
00066     const char *getName(void);
00067 
00068     /* Pass the register read/write operation to the AccessLayer object, but add in the device's
00069      * specific base address first.
00070      */
00071         uint8_t  read8(uint32_t offset);
00072         void     write8(uint32_t offset, uint8_t val);
00073         uint16_t read16(uint32_t offset);
00074         void     write16(uint32_t offset, uint16_t val);
00075         uint32_t read32(uint32_t offset);
00076         void     write32(uint32_t offset, uint32_t val);
00077 
00078         /* Block Access Methods */
00079         void read8(uint32_t offset, uint8_t *val, size_t len, bool incAddr=true);
00080         void write8(uint32_t offset, uint8_t *val, size_t len, bool incAddr=true);
00081         void read16(uint32_t offset, uint16_t *val, size_t len, bool incAddr=true);
00082         void write16(uint32_t offset, uint16_t *val, size_t len, bool incAddr=true);
00083         void read32(uint32_t offset, uint32_t *val, size_t len, bool incAddr=true);
00084         void write32(uint32_t offset, uint32_t *val, size_t len, bool incAddr=true);
00085 
00086         uint32_t getRange(void);
00087 
00088 
00089 protected:
00090     LatticeSemi_PCIe::RegisterAccess    *pReg;
00091     uint32_t                baseAddress;
00092     uint32_t                addrLimit;
00093     uint32_t                addrRange;
00094     string                  name;
00095 
00096 };

00108 class DLLIMPORT DeviceError : public exception 
00109 { 
00110    public:
00111        DeviceError(char *s) {msg = s;}
00112        virtual const char *what(void) const throw()
00113        {
00114            return(msg);
00115        }
00116 
00117    private:
00118        char *msg;
00119 };
